intro: Diplycosia elliptica, commonly known as the elliptic diplycosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as an understory plant in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticultural and ecological studies.
